alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas; Tama; Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 25 at 1:29PM CST until January 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Bitter Cold Continues Through Wednesday... .Cold temperatures and bitter wind chill values will continue into Wednesday. Bitter wind chills will spread from north to south as the evening progresses, and will continue to do this overnight into Wednesday morning. While winds overnight will be light, the air temperatures will drop well below zero degrees, augmenting wind chill values further downward with any gentle breeze. The coldest values will be in northern and northeastern Iowa overnight. ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Northern and east-central Iowa. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
